summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York in August 2019. The report includes references to attached interview recordings, transcripts, and prison documents like daily rosters and count sheets.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a previously housed inmate at MCC New York who died while in custody.

connections.description: The OIG Senior Special Agent interviewed the BOP Lieutenant as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.
The OIG Special Agent participated in interviewing the BOP Lieutenant.
The BOP Lieutenant was an Operations Lieutenant at MCC New York when inmate Jeffrey Epstein was housed there.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, recorded interview with a BOP Operations Lieutenant regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prison Counts and Rosters

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating the death of Jeffrey Epstein as of June 2021, nearly two years after the event.
The investigation involved interviewing BOP staff, specifically an Operations Lieutenant who was on duty at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.
The investigative record includes specific prison documents from the days surrounding Epstein's death, including daily assignment rosters and inmate count sheets for August 9-10, 2019.
The interview with the BOP Lieutenant was voluntary, recorded, and transcribed, indicating a formal evidence-gathering process.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum that contains no recommendations or conclusions, marking it as a factual record of an investigative step.
